name: GraphEmail
description: Send an email through Microsoft Graph (without SMTP server)
author: Sjoerd Hooft

inputs.name: To
inputs.label: To Addresses
inputs.helpMarkDown: To Address. Multiple addresses can be separated by a comma. Variables are supported. Example: $(BUILD.REQUESTEDFOREMAIL)

inputs.name: CC
inputs.label: CC Addresses
inputs.helpMarkDown: CC Address. Multiple addresses can be separated by a comma. Variables are supported. Example: $(BUILD.REQUESTEDFOREMAIL)

inputs.name: BCC
inputs.label: BCC Addresses
inputs.helpMarkDown: BCC Address. Multiple addresses can be separated by a comma. Variables are supported. Example: $(BUILD.REQUESTEDFOREMAIL)

inputs.name: From
inputs.label: From Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: From Address, can be a shared mailbox. The mailbox must exist.

inputs.name: Subject
inputs.label: Mail Subject
inputs.helpMarkDown: The subject of the email. Variables are supported. Example: Mail from $(BUILD.DEFINITIONNAME)

inputs.name: BodyAsHtml
inputs.label: Is HTML Body?:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify if the text in the Body is HTML formatted or not

inputs.name: ClientID
inputs.label: Client ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Client ID of Azure Enterprise App

inputs.name: ClientSecret
inputs.label: Client Secret
inputs.helpMarkDown: Client Secret of Azure Enterprise App. Variables are supported. Example: $(ClientSecret)

inputs.name: ShowClientSecret
inputs.label: Show Client Secret in logs:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify if you want to display the Client Secret in the logs. If a secret variable is used the secret is never displayed in the log, even if this option is enabled.
